website_summaries.verdict: The Toshiba D-R410 handles basic DVD-recorder functions at a budget price, but you can get better features and performance from Panasonic's DMR-EA18K, if you're willing to spend a little more.
pros: performs basic DVD recordings without a problem
supports most recordable DVD formats, including dual-layer discs
cons: Mediocre recording quality below the XP level
does not include a USB port or SDHC card slot
lack of IR blaster makes it annoying to schedule recordings

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba DR410 DVD recorder
customer_reviews.text: Kevin at KC Clearing House was very professional and knowledgeable in helping me with my Toshiba DVD player/recorder. Kevin answered all my pre sale questions and was very candid in helping me choose this DVD player from others he was offering for sale. Kevin also recommended a few technology tips once my device arrived. It's a great price performer. I would purchase other electronic gear from KC Clearing House without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase
customer_reviews.text: When buying used electronics, I always hold off reviewing until I have a chance to do extensive testing. I did testing with this recorder and it runs very good. Case was in good shape with only a minor blemish or two. I would have given it another star had it come with a remote, but that wasn't a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: markfp

customer_reviews.title: Not many DVD Recorders around anymore so get this!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Toshiba DR410 1080p Upconverting Tunerless DVD Recorder to replace my old one which was destroyed by a fall while moving. This is a great machine and is very easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nicholas Nieves

customer_reviews.title: A DVD Recorder that WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: The Toshiba D-R410 DVD Video Recorder combines simplicity of operation with high quality performance, all at a very affordable price. Connection between either a satellite receiver or a VCR and TV monitor via RCA audio/video cables was a breeze, and my first recordings looked great. For this manner of hookup, a built-in tuner isn't required, and its absence contributes to the unit's affordability. I've recorded using both DVD+R and +RW discs with equal satisfaction. I recommend it without reservation to anyone seeking a "no frills", "does its job well" DVD Recorder that will be used with either a cable, satellite, or home VCR signal input.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndy E.

customer_reviews.title: Record with ease.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this some while ago because my dvd recorder quit working on my old laptop. This device hooked up easily and worked great. I was able to record and play with no problems at all. The price was great too, just about $13. I'd definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: cherie the gadget queen

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up and use with any converter and tv
customer_reviews.text: I record both daytime and nighttime programs for my elderly mother who doesn't get reception. This early model is much more reliable than the later models, and tashiba works and lasts much longer than any other brand. I bought my first one back in 2009 and it lasted for over 9 years recording day and night on CBS. I have 4 of them currently recording, and the one I just ordered is a back up just in case.
customer_reviews.author: brenda s.

customer_reviews.title: Easiest DVD Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I HAd to buy this because somone I give DVD's to said the Samsung 357 was giving errors. I was not so sure, but for the price of one of these as a refurb, I cured my error problems ( probably a tired laser). This recorder offers limited speed options and in video mode (-R) makes a really plain-jane DVD ( especially compared to the Samsung menus) unless you use +R ad edit it. But it is the easiest one I have used ( Pioneer Samsung Phillips) to just insert a DVD and press "record". At the end you just name it and finalize. Really very easy to do. A good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Penname

customer_reviews.title: Recording DVE
customer_reviews.text: The DVD recorder works good, but the DVD's will not play in a Blue-Ray player. Other than this I would recommend the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just received this unit and am learning how to use it. So far, it appears to work decently. However, I am spoiled by another machine I have - a Panasonic which allows use of DVD-RAM discs. This Toshiba model doesn't allow RAM discs. It does, however, allow marking chapters and then "hiding" those chapters - effectively allowing editing of unwanted bits (commercials) from recorded programs, etc. That is a plus, although apparently only while using +RW or -RW discs. Still, a decent machine for the decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Jizmo

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after viewing the other reviews with their various pros and cons, and I can say the recorder has worked well for me. I was looking for an inexpensive way to transfer a number of home movies on VHS onto DVD, and so far so good after more than half a dozen discs so far. I found the model easy to hook up and fairly simple to operate, and the results are good. Very good sound and image, with minimal loss of quality in going to the next generation.
customer_reviews.author: RLM

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba D-R410KU
customer_reviews.text: Have this recorder now for about one month. Bottom line for me is picture quality. I only record with a DVD-R disc. Toshhiba, recommends for DVD-R to use either Verbatim or Maxell. I tried both and found the Maxell made the best copies. Machine is very easy to set up and for $99.00 you can't go wrong. This is the best recorder I have had for some time. I would recommend this DVD recorder/player to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: John Q Public

customer_reviews.title: Good Results
customer_reviews.text: This recorder is very low cost and does a good job. It does not have component inputs which would be a welcome way to get signal in but it has S-Video and RCA. It was somewhat confusing to set up for me with my satellite box but the Toshiba tech support people are very helpful and that's a really good resoource. I've used it for over 100 hours of recorded transfers from my DVR and it worked well every time.
customer_reviews.author: Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: This DVD Recorder makes excellent recordings from my DVR, which is my principal use for it. My only problem with it is that I am unable to figure out intuitively how to finalize a disk without the manual, even though I have done it once and am experienced with various DVD's. So I wind up letting it record whatever I have on until the disk ends so it will automatically finalize.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon O. Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a family member, and he loves it. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Sylvester Harper

customer_reviews.title: WORKS PERFECTLY  AND IS PRESERVING MEMORIES
customer_reviews.text: THE UNIT LOOKS NEW, WORKS GREAT AND I HAVE ZERO COMPLAINTS
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: toshiba dr-410
customer_reviews.text: the recorder and upconverting portion of this model work well, however, it did not come with the correct remote for the model dr-410, it came with a remote for the dr-400, which works, but does not allow all the features to be used!
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba DR410 review
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Toshiba recorder. My other is a combo dvd/vcr recorder which has worked perfectly for 4 years. The new DR410 was purchased to connect directly to our Direct TV satellite dish box after converting from cable. The recording process is extremely simple and both loading and finalizing is much quicker than with the older Toshiba, and output quality is indistinguishable from the live source. In all am quite satisfied with both the product and the price, which is lower than any other source I checked and you can' beat the "free shipping!"
customer_reviews.author: O. Livaudais

customer_reviews.title: DVD Recorder
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price on this refurbished DVD Recorder. Works great, recording copies from VHS Tapes.Follow the steps on quick list. If you just want to do basic recording.You have 3 sources.L1-L2-L3.L1 and L2 for VHS or DVD if not copywritten or digital box to record programming.L3 for camcorders.You can use RCA Cables S-Video or HDMI connector.You have to by remote choose what connection to record, don't assume.and after recording ,make sure you finalized recorded DVD.Will not playback on other DVD players.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to explore all the options that it has. My biggest disappointment was the chapter settings didn't carry over to other players, but I'm not convinced it wasn't in my set-up yet. I haven't gotten too far into recording with it at this point, but I haven't had some of the issues that a friends dvr has had like not playing on other players at all, or locking up half way through the recording. There's more extra features to this than I had expected and I'm looking forward to what I might be able to accomplish with them.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ramey

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba D-R410
customer_reviews.text: Bought this open box product direct from Amazon. As usual, the condition way surpassed my expectations. It may have been open box and advertised as used, but it was still in original wrapping and I believe it was brand new. Everything claimed about this DVR is true. The only frustration I have is the slow loading. I checked to see if there was a firmware upgrade for this but there is not. I can recommend it for its playback quality through a 1080p hi def tv. Have only used the recorder once and am satisfied with the quality. Please read the manual regarding finalizing the recording otherwise you'll wonder why you can't play it back on other DVD players
customer_reviews.author: Keeper

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to archive my old Hi-8 video tapes and this did just that. A very short learning curve. Once on a power failure I was sure I had made a coaster, but no the unit recovered where it was on that DVD disk and went ahead and appended the rest of the video. A good no frill product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: Nice product for the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product so that I could transfer some old VHS tapes to digital form. The product arrived in due time. Setup was easy and operation is straight forward. I think this is an excellent unit for under $100. The ONLY drawback I see with the unit is the lack of a coaxial input. It was not possible to route my video signal directly from my Dish outlet to the DR410. I had to route the signal through the VHS recorder. This is an inconvenience and one that keeps this recorder from getting a 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Epiman

customer_reviews.title: So far so good...
customer_reviews.text: We've had it for two year now, and have recorded at least two hundred hours. The playback is slow. Really slow. But the recording is easy and the quality options are diverse enough that you can do 8 hours of kids' animation and then tape a two hour high quality movie. It allows you to tape movies and shows; some recorders stop taping when they hit the protection signals, but this one keeps taping. The upconvert is nice...it makes homemade DVD's look better. It doesn't play photographs, which I was disappointed to find out. But otherwise, it's been working well for us. It didn't come with an HDMI cord...given how cheap they are, you'd think it would be included.
customer_reviews.author: tired mom of two boys

customer_reviews.title: Good product..inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this product as my wife wanted to save some DVR recorded programs as well as some old camcorder tapes. It works as advertised, no problems to date. One quirk though...the upconversion of prerecorded DVD's is not quite as good as the Pioneer DVD player that it replaced. Still, I would recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Hiller

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba DR410 DVD
customer_reviews.text: I hooked it up to my cablebox as instructed, then the test was to record from the DVR! Well after a few trials it worked well. After finalizing the hour long program which did not take long - the result was a perfect copy! I also use the Toshiba DVD to watch home DVD's.
customer_reviews.author: Joe F

customer_reviews.title: Great Recorder
customer_reviews.text: Own this model for a couple of years. Never had any problems recording or playing DVDs. Mine is set to record off of a cable box and also from a VCR unit. Re-recording my old VHS tapes onto blank DVDs and never had a problem. The picture quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I have three that I purchased used ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have three that I purchased used many years ago. Easy to learn. They are still working fine. I'll be sad when they break down.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to find DVDs recorders now days. This is a very reliable devices.
customer_reviews.author: Akamai_Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with this recorder. I record tv programs & get a pretty good picture using dvd-rw & dvd-r in EP mode. This recorder is easy to use & is very dependable. It can read most discs unless they are really messed up. I haven't had to use any discs for coasters as I did with my previous recorder. I highly recommend this recorder.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I am not a technophile or geek. I bought this basically for convenience and price. I have no complaints. The price was less than everyone else and with the bundle it was even better. I have no complaints. The service/delivery was fast and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Thom Davies

customer_reviews.title: a little learning curve
customer_reviews.text: This recorder WORKS..All it takes is to read the manual, call for excellent C/S if needed..DVD recording is harder than VHS. The results are 10 times better. I can not (but I do) believe the quality that this recorder outouts to the consumer. A very good product....
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Great Unit-Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Am so pleased with this unit-have changed out of a Sony burner that is apparently decided to not find a signal from any source. This is a great option and addition to our system. We have 2 Sony DVD changers which are great space savers and play our prerecorded movies that feed through this unit. Having this single player in the system has covered the one flaw in the Sony Changers-playing 2 sided discs. All two sided disks now get played on this unit and has allowed us to reconfigure out video colection. Great Price doesn't hurt either!!! Thanks Guys!!!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba DR410
customer_reviews.text: If you need to convert your old crusty VHS tapes to a DVD the product is GREAT!! You need to however find the best speeds (SP, ESP, etc..) in order to get the best quality on the DVD. Also if you do not finalize on a DVD-RW you will not be able to play on other devices (laptop, desktop, dvd-player). There is a editing tool to name each eposide on the DVD however, very cumbersome. You can only click on one letter/number at a time by arrowing to it. Also very limited in special characters as well. What do you want for $100.00?
customer_reviews.author: V. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Finally decided to upgrade from VCR recording to DVD and I couldn't be happier. An added plus, it has inputs on the front so I can record my old home videos on Video8 tapes on DVD. Fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: throw away your vcr
customer_reviews.text: I love these units and have one for each of my 3 TVs. Only drawback is you have to remember to leave the cable box on the channel you want to record! Great quality image even at 6 hrs per disc.
customer_reviews.author: P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money, but noisy
customer_reviews.text: In the $100 price range, this recorder was a bargain, but I returned it to Amazon because of the noise and speed of the mechanical functions. If you don't think that will bother you, it's a steal. I think a newer version is now available, model DR-420. Maybe they've made that one a little quieter and a little faster in loading up the DVD. The return to Amazon was pain free. I really like doing business with them.
customer_reviews.author: David Fussell

customer_reviews.title: DVD recorder
customer_reviews.text: Product works great.Mine was purchased refurbished for $[...].As with most dvd recorders you have to format the dvd after recording on it.As long as you do that it will work in all your players.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I used this DVD recorder to record DVD from tape, DVR, TV, and they work well. t is a good machine to record video into DVD as long as there is a RCA connector. I got it from Amazon for $99. Can't beat it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I wanted it to do - allow me to save stuff from my dvr to disk. This was an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: P. S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: pretty user friendly and she was so happy recording
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for my mom to record all her shoes, pretty user friendly and she was so happy recording.
customer_reviews.author: Grecia Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba DVR
customer_reviews.text: Scary at first! The manual is long but thorough. I set it up and got it working all by myself and I'm not an electronics wiz! I didn't have any problems integrating it with my cable. I'm happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for transferring 8mm video
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to transfer 16 years of 8mm tape to DVD format. This DVD recorder did the job very easily. I especially liked the automatic chapter insertion.
customer_reviews.author: dadofthree

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is what you need to record from a DVR or "other feed" to make copies of what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Bassinator

customer_reviews.title: Great recorder for less than $100
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one reason alone...to put my old home videos recorded in 8mm and VHS cassettes into DVD. It was all so simple. This recorder has input jacks and all I need to do is connect the output of my old Canon camcorder to the input jacks of the recorder. Same thing with my VHS player. My ultimate goal was to rip the DVD into my laptop and that went also smoothly. As an added bonus, I can now record TV shows with this recorder and watch it later in the laptop while commuting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple to operate and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've owned about 10 different DVD recorders so far and this is the simplest, most reliable and less expensive of the lot.
customer_reviews.author: Lomapaseo

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This Recorder is easy to use.My Mom needed one,and I did a lot of checking,and this recorder;for the price,is the best.To record;you have to hook it up to the cable box.The new recorder's,are not like the old ones.Buy it,and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Woods

customer_reviews.title: "Very Pleased"
customer_reviews.text: Toshiba DR410 is a fine machine!!! Many options you can use to enhance your DVD'S Large instruction booklet (over 100 pages) Had trouble hooking up VCR/DVD/TV to copy VCR tapes to DVD But, Just a few calls to Toshiba and they were very clear with they instructions and helpfull to get me started. (American based Tecks-speaking clear english) RIP
customer_reviews.author: R. Poff

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished product
customer_reviews.text: I've never purchased a factory refurbished product before but this is performing well and I would use this supplier again.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde P. Peters

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to convert our videos to dvd's. It has been working great. We move it from TV to TV and it is easily connected.
customer_reviews.author: B. Horn

customer_reviews.title: Typical Toshiba - rock solid and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace a Samsung. Excellent quality, easy to use. Works very well with my Tivo.
customer_reviews.author: HJS3

customer_reviews.title: You get what you Pay for....
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty basic unit that is cheap but utilitarian. Spend a little extra a get an upgraded unit...or better yet, I wish I had simply paid a few dollars more and got a Blue Ray machine as they have dropped in price like a rock, and have all the HDMI annd other whistles for not much more. The set up of this machine is also a little bit of a pain, but not impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Carol
customer_reviews.text: We have used the DVD Recorder and are very happy with it. It works terrific. Your shipping was very quick and it arrived in good shape. Thank you for such good service.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S. Englehart

customer_reviews.title: Another DVD in the house
customer_reviews.text: Meets expectations for video quality. Buttons on handheld not very easy to find and use. Not intuative. On-screen menu not very intuitive. Many selections to get to finalize.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Wareheim

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with the functioning of this recorder. It is very easy to use. So far no coasters and no complaints. Doesn't get much better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta

customer_reviews.title: Does not play DivX
customer_reviews.text: Though I didn't see it mentioned specifically, I assumed that since DR400 played DivX, so would this model. I have tried all kinds of DivX recordings, but DR410 cannot play them. Having said that, the actual DVD recording works very well, it's very easy and the recording quality is good. Have not had a chance to test the upconversion quality. To summarize, I needed a DVD recorder, and since my older DVD player did not play DivX, was also hoping to kill another bird with the same stone, and was unsuccessful. If it played DivX, this would likely have been a raving 5-star review, it was just too big of a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: spartak1

customer_reviews.title: Could really use a tuner
customer_reviews.text: It does the job converting my family vhs to dvd. It also works great as an upconverting player. No tuner is a big negative. I've found that the tuner on my tv only works with the set turned on. That means that I cannot setup a timed recording, set the TV to the channel I want, turn off the TV and go away. If I want to record while I am sleeping, the TV needs to be on. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: get home alive

customer_reviews.title: Defective S Video port
customer_reviews.text: I was going to buy 2 of these. Bought one, S-Video port was bad. I'll try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Toy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Just dandy!
customer_reviews.text: Gets 'er done! This has a lot of features that probably I will never use. But I have a whole bunch of VHS tapes that I want to copy to dvd, because they take up so much room. The remote control that comes with it has a lot of buttons but hey, you will use every one of them! I think it's a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: Rene L. Davey

customer_reviews.title: DVDs only play on THIS machine
customer_reviews.text: When my old Lite-On dvd recorder finally gave up the ghost I bought this Toshiba machine. It works fine but for one MAJOR thing. The DVDs it burns only play on THIS machine! I have two other dvd players, both Sony and while the DVDs I made with the Lite-On machine play fine on them, these don't play at all. What's the deal with this?
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Used Toshiba DR410 DVD Recorder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item knowing that it was used.The IR sensor on the recorder was defective. I determined this by trying another remote of the same model. It too failed. I returned the unit to the vendor for a full refund including his shipping cost. Unfortunately, I had to pay for the return shipment.
customer_reviews.author: magneticnorm

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba DR410 tunerless DVD recorder
customer_reviews.text: I believe that this product is fine, but I had to return it because I do not have the resources (space and equipment) to use this. My equipment is old and I am too old to get new TV and Vcr and DVD players.
customer_reviews.author: John Lucarelli

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, except ...
customer_reviews.text: This is easy to hook up, easy to navigate as the other reviewers will say and no need for me to repeat. However, for my use it is missing one essential, to my thinking, feature. That is, you cannot watch one program while recording another. I guess I am spoiled with the old DVR that finally gave up on me.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Well, it recorded but ...
customer_reviews.text: one has to play the TV in order to record, as the recorder has no tuner. It's impossible to record your favorite TV shows when you go away. The r/w process is very slow. Also, the Toshiba technical support wasn't helpful. The one I spoke to did not know the device well.
customer_reviews.author: Echoecho

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Product
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product could make DVD's from tapes. But that is not quite true. You have to hook up a VCR to this DVD to make tapes into DVD's. Somehow this was not explained in the verbage. I sent it back. And, Amazon had the guts to charge me for shipping.
customer_reviews.author: George J. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Know what you need
customer_reviews.text: In my ignorance, I did not understand the meaning of "tunerless" . I have cable TV and thought it would be fine but you must have some sort of box. It was easy to set up but took me awhile to understand why it did not work.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

product_meta.title: Toshiba DR410 1080p Upconverting Tunerless DVD Recorder

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars161 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
